name: io.github.dmarx/claudetube
description: Process and analyze YouTube videos - transcripts, frame extraction, scene detection, and intelligent Q&A. Supports 1500+ video sites via yt-dlp.

tools.name: process_video_tool
tools.description: Download and process a video from URL - fetches metadata, transcript, and thumbnail

tools.name: get_frames
tools.description: Extract frames from a video at specified timestamps

tools.name: get_hq_frames
tools.description: Extract high-quality frames for reading text/code

tools.name: get_transcript
tools.description: Get full transcript for a cached video

tools.name: get_scenes
tools.description: Get scene structure with timestamps and summaries

tools.name: find_moments_tool
tools.description: Search for moments in a video matching a query

tools.name: watch_video_tool
tools.description: Actively watch and reason about a video to answer questions

tools.name: get_playlist
tools.description: Get playlist metadata and video list

tools.name: extract_entities_tool
tools.description: Extract entities (objects, people, concepts) from video scenes

tools.name: track_people_tool
tools.description: Track people across scenes in a video

tools.name: detect_narrative_structure_tool
tools.description: Detect video narrative structure (intro, main, conclusion)

tools.name: track_code_evolution_tool
tools.description: Track code changes across scenes in coding tutorials

serverInstructions: Use claudetube when users share video URLs (YouTube, Vimeo, TikTok, etc.) and want to understand video content, extract information, or answer questions about what happens in videos. Start with process_video_tool, then use get_transcript for text content or get_frames/get_hq_frames for visual content.
